label_layer_damage: Total damage in the residential sector
label_layer_soil_moisture: Soil moisture of the root zone
map_error_msg:
There was a problem getting this layer. We are sorry for the inconvenience.
Try the other layers or come back later
menu_PrecipitationForce_tooltip:
The force of the precipitation event as a qualitative category
The events were derived from the Baden-WÃ¼rttemberg-wide KoStRA data
menu_SoilMoisture_tooltip: The soil moisture before the rain event
menu_colorscale_tooltip: Change the colorscale for the current layer
menu_date_selection_tooltip: Select one of the possible events based on the date
menu_date_static_tooltip: This is the date of the precipitation event
menu_kind_tooltip: Should the precipitation event be a real event or a virtual/design event?
menu_opacity_tooltip: Change the Opacity of the layer to better see the background
menu_preparedness_tooltip: The preparedness level for the event indicates how many protective measures a region has already implemented and how well it is therefor prepared for certain events. This level has an impact on the expected total damage.
menu_region_map_tooltip: Select one of the example regions from the map
menu_region_tooltip: Select one of the example regions
node_ai_depth_tooltip: The maximum flooding depth determined by the AI model
node_ai_speed_tooltip: The maximum flow velocity determined by the AI model
node_ai_tooltip: These layers were computed by an artificial intelligence (AI) model that got trained for Emmendingen. In a real-time forecasting application, these layers could be computed within seconds.
node_damage_tooltip: The estimated total damage for the given scenario determined by a KI model (Bayesian network).
node_oa_tooltip: The precipitation water that flows off the surface
node_precipitation_tooltip: The precipitation that has been set. In this case, it is a design precipitation
node_sfi_tooltip:
PFI: Pluvial Flood Index (german: SFI)
The expected hazard class due to a flash flood
node_soil_moisture_tooltip: The soil moisture before the rain event
node_sri_tooltip:
HRI: Heavy Rain Index (german: SRI)
The index class of the rain event
onboarding_button_tooltip: Start an introduction to the PFI Demonstrator to get to know the functionalities
onboarding_flowchart_title: This flowchart represents the model chain. By clicking on one of the nodes you can select the diferent layers to be displayed on the map.
onboarding_map_layer_description: After a region has been selected, the layer selected in the flowchart will be displayed on the map. When you hover over the map, you will see the exact values of this layer.
onboarding_map_region_description: At the beginning, the map shows an overview of the possible regions. Select one of the regions on the map by clicking on one of the rectangles.
onboarding_menu_kind_description: Here you can choose between a fictional matrix and a real event.
onboarding_menu_map_description: In this menu you can adjust the representation of the current map. Here you can also select a different color scale for each layer.
onboarding_menu_matrix_description: In this menu you can define the different input conditions and see the effects on the map.
onboarding_menu_region_description: Alternatively to selecting the region on the map, you can also select a region from the dropdown list.
tooltip_sfgf_1: Pluvial flood hazard area. The area where a pluvial flood would create a hazard for humans or infrastructure.
tooltip_sri_return_period: The statistical frequency of this SRI is {{T}} years.
